BusinessName.BusinessNameLine1Txt: The Trinity Foundation dba Marianapolis Preparatory School

IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: To educate students in the Catholic tradition of academic excellence with a commitment to an active faith in God and a dedication to building character with content, compassion, and integrity.
IRS990.MissionDesc: To educate students in the Catholic
IRS990.Desc: THE TRINITY FOUNDATION D/B/A MARIANAPOLIS PREPARATORY SCHOOL IS AN INDEPENDENT SECONDARY SCHOOL FOR GRADES 9 THRU 12, WHICH HELPS THE STUDENTS DEVELOP CRITICAL AND ANALYTICAL THINKING SKILLS; TO BUILD COMMUNICATING AND PROBLEM-SOLVING SKILLS; TO PROMOTE THE LOVE OF LEARNING AND THE HIGHEST STANDARDS OF ACADEMIC ACHIEVEMENT; TO FOSTER AESTHETIC SENSITIVITY AND CREATIVITY; TO ENCOURAGE THE IDEAL OF SOUND MIND AND BODY; TO APPRECIATE THE VALUE OF CULTURAL DIVERSITY; TO NUTURE ACTIVE AND INTELLIGENT CITIZENSHIP IN THE WORLD; AND TO AFFIRM CATHOLIC PRINCIPLES THROUGH ETHICAL AND MORAL VALUES.

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The School invests its endowment funds to generate income and long-term growth. The income of which is utilized in accordance with donor stipulations, if any, and support of the School's exempt activities. The appreciation is utilized in accordance with the School's spending policy.

Management believes the School has no uncertain tax positions as of June 30, 2015. The School's Federal and State Form 990, Return of Organization Exempt from Income Tax, and Forms 990-T, Exempt Organization Business Income Tax Returns, are subject to examination by the IRS, generally, for three years after they are filed. The School's Federal and State tax filings prior to the year ended 2012 are closed.
Financial aid expenses, placement fees, and summer school expenses reported net of tuition and fees = $2,314,166.
Financial aid expenses, placement fees, and summer school expenses reported net of tuition and fees = $2,314,166.
STATEMENT OF NON-DESCRIMINATORY POLICY WAS PUBLISHED IN LOCAL AND REGIONAL NEWSPAPERS. STATEMENT OF SCHOOL'S NON-DISCRIMINATION POLICY WAS PUBLISHED IN LOCAL AND REGIONAL NEWSPAPERS.
Assistance is granted based on the need of each individual student.
The Head of School is required to live on campus in order to effectively perform his duties, which includes hosting events and to be available to Board Members, faculty, staff, and students.

BusTrInvolveInterestedPrsnGrp.RelationshipDescriptionTxt: Wife of Head/Dir of OnLine Learning

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The Form 990 is reviewed by Management of the School prior to its submission to the IRS.
The School discusses the policy with the Board of Directors and employees. Each Boardd Member annually submits a signed conflict of interest statement.

The School's Board of Directors use comparability statistics and National Association of Independent Schools benchmark studies to determine compensation of the Head of School. The Board of Directors approves the contract of the Head of School.
The School's Head of School and Board of Directors benchmark the salaries of key employees and officers to salaries and benefits of like schools.
The Form 990, governing documents, conflict of interest policy, and financial statements are maintained in the School's business office and are available upon request.
